post_title: If I buy the viewer pass after the start of the major, will I still have the coin upgraded?
post_body: If I have participated in all the stages of the major so far, having made 5 hits but only purchasing the viewer pass afterwards (before finishing), will I still have the medal upgraded or will it only count the stages I participate in after purchasing the viewer pass??
comments: > The Pick'Em Challenge is free to play, but if you want to upgrade your Shanghai 2024 Coin (and earn extra Souvenir Packages), make sure to activate your Viewer Pass before the event begins.
No, you need to buy and activate the pass before games starts
Even if I got five guesses right in the initial phase?
Yep

post_title: Does anyone have any recommendations on how I should properly hold Mirage short if I know the enemy team is about to push through? I've put some images of positions I've used before but not sure how effective they actually are. (I'm at 12K elo if that makes any difference on what I should do)
comments: There's no simple answer to this, it depends what info you have and where your teammates are. If you have another b one of you can play close and the other can take contact. If you're alone you can play back site near bench or car. The answer to this is really to play off your closest teammate or else to play as safe as possible until a rotate comes in.
Last pic is the safest as you have lots of cover in all directions. Depending on if I have cover from market I’d play farther back like bench or near van/under window

I guess it depends on what info you have. If you know its a lot, then a passive angle. If its two, then you can play closer and trade your life for 1 kill if a teammate is about to rotate or already on site.

Literally all these positions except for the last one suck lol

  
Play against the left wall with a smaller angle than nr 1 or behind bench.
go bench or play in ladder
If you find yourself stuck in pic 2. Don't hold in the corner. Go a bit more to the right so you have more of an angle on them running in. More of an off angle and it's easier to kill them.

if it’s more than 2 then hold something you can fall back and change position like the last pic. if it’s just 1 or 2 you can hold close to cat like the first couple pics. if it’s just one player you can hold flat on the wall like pic 2

I wouldn’t count on using off angles where you are holding out in the open. Pick one with cover and get used to working around it so you can do it blind. The best bet is probably playing around the pillar or the boxes on site.

I saw in your other comment you are not confident in your aim yet so it's best to play a position where you can contact then fall back into safety. 

You can try play in bench or on site, your 6th photo is a great position. If you have the default CT agent skin, B site's visibility is actually pretty messed up in your favour.

[https://imgur.com/a/O28LpI5](https://imgur.com/a/O28LpI5)

If your team has control of Apartments you can also watch short from there, it is generally pretty difficult for T's to fight you in Apartment if you also have teammates rotating in from Market.
Use utility. Throw a smoke, hold the smoke. Use a pop flash. Or call out to your team that they're going B and retreat deeper into the site, like bench or truck
i use to be global elite now here me stay with m4a1-s or ak 47 or awp back of the chair if you have smg or m4a4 or galil then hide back of the truck
I dont like 3 or 5 the most. Dont be afraid to be Van, apps, apps balc or bench
i'm more focusing on in the mid round, where i've already used most of my util.
Mostly used these positions as examples because I usually play short with another teammate watching apps. If I’m on my own I’ll usually play further back into the site
dont use all your utility early round if they dont rush all the time

Ah then you shouldnt be afraid of being even farther up. If they are running in apps you should be able to hear them, so you can play at the pallet, ladder room and fighting top mid with your Con player. You can molly under (with some delay, they cant be there that fast) and smoke half way up cat to take foghts against a player on chair or behind the boxes. You can also molly behind the boxes basically asap to get good fights with your conn and window player too
Edit- if you hear them running up you can play pic 2 facing the other way and your conn/mid player should call if they can be cat
I try not to
Thanks for the advice. I generally play more passive because I don’t have my aim down enough that I can feel confident enough to play proactively

Yeah its often easier to be aggressive and be picking when you want a fight VS passive and needing to be dialed in when they peak or picking a random time to fight and get a lucky timing when stuck in more of a corner.

post_title: PW Shanghai: Elimination Stage final matchups
comments:
Furia x pain inferno gonna go down as pure Brazilian cs

None of the teams wanted to win but someone had to take it lmao
Thx G2, Liquid and Spirit for securing my pickem. Gold dream still alive.
Everyone celebrating Mouz/Navi/Faze missing each other, but there’s also a chance that all of them get knocked out lol
Thank god furia didn't bottle that after that 5 glocks loss.
im starting to feel the 2-3 NAVI
Pls faze, this is your best possible match up. Just play like you did against mouz, not how you played g2
Furia v. Faze a mid-off. Whoever losses less stupid rounds wins! LFG!!!
damn i actually feel bad for heroic, they have to play faze, mongolz, spirit and navi

FURIA no joke saved the entire bracket. Had they lost, it would have been Navi-Faze, Heroic-Mouz and 2 brazil teams vs each other, which would have been DEVASTATING not just for top teams, but for EU as well
FaZe couldn't have asked for a better match up.

Had either Pain or Heroic won that 2-2 bracket would have been some straight nonsense, Disaster avoided.

Also generally would say liquid are worthy of playoffs but the competition theyve beaten to get there is pretty ridiculous when you look at some of who those 2-2 teams have had to take on. Faze have played Heroic, Mouz, G2; Heroic played Faze, Mongolz, Spirit and then Navi; While liquid get in with GL, Furia then MIBR.

Edit: Apparently Liquid fans seem to think nearly beating Navi means they deserve an easy bracket, no ones saying liquid dont deserve playoffs but its strange to argue that this wasnt the easiest run to playoffs of the major.

There’s a world where we might see two Brazilians teams in the major playoffs.

PGL KRAKOW almost if both makes it.

Nah but that Heroic vs Navi is gonna be a huge bloodbath, gl to them

I feel so bad for heroic.

What a horrible run to play 3/4 top teams to go through.

They’ve looked a threat all tournament and have the map pool to go deep given the right opponents.

The way they’re playing I would have had them beating G2 or Liquid should they have matched up.

IMO their game tomorrow vs navi is 5050, I have no doubt Nertz and co will show up, let’s see which Navi comes to the stage. If it’s Aleksib vs the world again tomorrow Heroic are through for sure.
Double "clutching defeat from the jaws of victory" possible if Heroic and mibr, both 2-0 teams, go 2-3 in the end.
Praying Faze beats furia so spirit avoid g2 in playoffs lmao
Mouz, Navi & Faze all win please 🙏 Have a chance at an all time great playoffs if they do.
i need a faze or a navi tomorrow!

How are you this fast?

Thanks.

This is the best shot for NiKo to get his major imo. From the way the bracket looks, Vitality will be the biggest threat. It looks like he'll have another fairytale story to overcome in Mongolz. I'm obviously getting ahead of myself but that will be a seriously fantastic grand final.
Honestly the first time in my life that i've actually gotten pick'ems easily. Might actually get 8/10 if tomorrow goes well.

post_title: MithR tweet after qualifying for the Shanghai Major Play-offs
comments:
Everybody else gets a shoutout for their personal narrative

Meanwhile, NAF just naffing
Lets go. Big fan of this team, I hope they show up in playoffs, will definitely need everyone on top of their game if they want to make a run

Lmao someone pointed out he still had an Apex profile pic which is the thumbnail for this post as well. 

He changed it in the meantime to a Liquid picture.
I'm assuming they'll get smashed when they play against a legitimately good team in playoffs.
They played against plumbers and got lucky pairings. Liquid would get smoked against a decent T1 team. Dude should put his head down and work

Naf shows up, plays like a legend, goes home and does it again the next day.

He is the ultimate trooper
if they could hold their nerves they could legitimately become a serious contender. mind you the only teams they lost against in their current roster were the top 5 teams (and also wildcard lol)

Whether you think they played against better teams or not - getting top 8 in a major is still an achievement and with the mentioned narratives of each individual players, is definitely a moment to celebrate. 

> Dude should put his head down and work 

I would believe this achievement is the results of their work?
only t1 team navi have played against was spirit where they got destroyed 13-2. Liquid had to play against navi in their first round and they didnt get smoked. is navi not a t1 team now?

> Liquid would get smoked against a decent T1 team

When they face top teams they can bring games quite close, for a team like liquid that is a huge achievement
They are still in the tournament, are they not? Jobs not finished. Hr can tweet after the major is over, acting like their major is already over.
Yeah they lost against Navi? Whats your point? And Navi are playing like shit and might not make playoffs. They lost against an underperforming Navi. Your point doesnt make sense.
Salty for no reason. They beat everyone in front of them except for top 5 teams + faze. They can be happy about their success

Tournament is definitely not over, but I think you're also diminishing a top 8 finish like it means nothing. They've fought through qualifiers and group stages to get there, same with others that have reached top 8.

> acting like their major is already over.

I personally don't see this tweet as them acting like the major is already over, but a celebration of a minor milestone towards their bigger goal > Winning the Major
They have almost a week until their next match lol

Holy shit how delusional do you have to be to assume that after tweeting about being happy to make the next stage that mithr and liquid are just doing nothing to work and prep for the next stage. People like you are insufferable
By your logic, Liquid is performing better than Navi at the moment which makes them the better team
13-10 in a bo1 sure is a big loss
[deleted]

What's a better take?

They've lost one bo3, out of 10 total lost in 28 total played, to a team outside the top 5+faze and it was online and against a team they 2-0'd later in the same online tournament.

comments: NA TEAM IS BACK IN MAJOR PLAYOFFS

✅Vitality

✅Wildcard

✅G2

✅Liquid 

4 POINTS !

Ultimate's thoughts after making it to playoffs in his *first major:*

"It was fun"

Nothings guaranteed in a Liquid match but getting Anubis as the decider during the veto felt like it was nearly impossible to throw.  Finally back in the playoffs of a major, there’s going to be no “easy” matchups moving forward let’s get it!!
God please if Yekindar and Ultimate can keep this up against actual top teams to have a run in playoffs I'll never ask for anything ever again

"They double swung us Dark and we've thrown the A util with 20 seconds to go, lets go B through Dark!" 

How the fuck did NaVi lose to this team?

Also it's great to see Ultimate play well when it matters after his poor run of form recently.
Hell yeah top 8! So proud of this team and hope we can do some damage next round. I feel confident saying we’re the best Anubis team and it’s crazy we don’t play it as often. GG MIBR
thank fk liquid won. You absolutely do not want to be playing in the 2-2 bracket tomorrow, it's looking absolutely brutal
MAN IT FEELS GOOD TO BE BACK IN THE PLAYOFFS. Twistzz you’ve done an amazing job as IGL since you’ve came back bro, huge shout out to you.
flyquest run for mibr

Yekindar does great if he has people who go in with him, but also he has improved his decision making and patience. He quite a few times this match stayed back and waited for MIBR to come to him and it worked really well.
Idk what MIBR was thinking with this veto. I mean as a Liquid fan I can't complain, but seriously... can you veto worse than that?

In 3 out of the 4 possible outcomes of the last two matches, faze plays navi:(

Edit: I just checked my pickems and it seemed i misremembered my own pickems. So not only do I need faze to proceed for my heart, but also my pickems

God damn it’s nice to have my TL back. Let’s go. If Twistzz is a real IGL this is the most well balanced roster I can remember for TL.  
Yeki/Ultimate open rounds with a proper awper in Ulimate.  
NAF/jks closers with both being very good at playing mid/late round situations.  
Twistzz just filling in gaps when needed. If he can properly call T sides consistently this could finally be the one.
Let’s go lads
Yekindar on, ultimate bing chillin

Still an abysmal Nuke BUT…

TL are in playoffs!! Roland from Poland is on the big stage!!
Fuck yeaaah NA NA NA
Hell yea we're so back
5 more years of Liquid Yekindar boyz

comments: 11 rounds in 4 maps. 3dmax lost by a total of 11 rounds over 4 maps. The biggest loss was a bo1 vs g2 where they lost 13-8. Every other map they lost was 11-13. Legitimately heart breaking

That last round was certainly something 

Glad Mouz are still alive but damn gutted for 3DMax because they were fun to watch
No matter the result, this iteration of 3DMAX is really solid. Expecting them to perform better at future events.

Unless 3DMAX management actually get their shit together now, they need a better org

Also that Siuhy galil 1v2 double peek on d2 was filthy

What was up with Djoko during Nuke? The dude seemed lost most of the game, and the final round backpedalling into vent, wot? Unless he cleared the vent and saw no one, and the spectator cam didn't catch it...?

Unlucky 3DMAX but definitely hyped for this lineup and loved the way they approached their games this major even though it may have backfired at times. Some of the strats felt like solo queue but they genuinely payed off sometimes - respeckkkkk
I really like this 3dmax team, but Maka is really underwhelming with the AWP, he has very little impact on the games feel like.

Glad Mouz won but I have to say Djoko really impressed me every game and I am 110% sure he has played CS 1.6 and/or CS:S, his playstyle if very old schoolish and I loved seeing it work against any opponent.


I don't usually watch pro demos that much but I may have to watch his pov on every map he played this RMR/Major. Hope to see this team again next year.
3D max is fun for sure.  I hope to watch them more.
I really hope the 3DMax team sticks together through to Dallas next summer, whether it's with this org or not.
Fake cumback yet again sed

The Brazilian LG roster that went on to win 2 majors used to lose a lot of close games just before they hit that wave. So, while heartbreaking, a glass half full perspective could say this indicates they only have a few holes to fill to be true contenders.

Sad thing for this team is it seems like they never come online at the same time. Lucky deadlifted them through the RMR then went completely missing, Graviti and co stepped up a lot this stage but it wasn't enough. Hope they can find more consistency because their peaks are legitimately very high.
damn thats actually wild
Xertion got a good view from below of Djoko's thicc ass helped Mouz to overcome 3DMAX.
They'll get a few tier 1 invites now thanks to the VRS bump, hopefully 3DMAX can take that sticker money and actually stay alive for another year
at least they'll get plenty of invites to tier 1 events thanks to being high in VRS. I do agree on the better org part tho.
They paid them 6 months in advance for them to stay this time.
Uninstalled word.exe during the 30min pause
Yeah this is true, the loss for luminosity at the major right before they won was a similar heartbreakingly close set of games. 3D max can be t1 with a bit more work imo

post_title: How do people feel about Pro players using the crowd to their advantage?
post_body: I'm especially interested to hear the perspective of analysts and coaches. Just saw NiKo in the match vs. Faze try to bait a reaction from the crowd in Round 3 Inferno, 1v1 vs Frozen. I personally think it's unsportmanslike and desperate, although it is allowed (I think)
comments: Not the first time for Niko to bait reaction, also not the first time for any pro, i don't mind anyway

This is exactly what analysts call 'lan experience'. Many players have done this and it defo cuts both ways unless there is a biased crowd. The most impressive example of this in recent times was Vita vs G2 in the finals of IEM Dallas. Even though G2 had home crowd support, in one post plant situation Apex commed to Mezzi to hold the defuse until the crowd noise and then to peek the T to bait them. Pro players, especially IGLs, have often stated that some strats can't be called on LAN because of crowd noise. The best example of this was round 29 Navi vs Faze in map 5 (Nuke) Cologne 2022 finals where Twistzz got the drop on Electronic as he couldn't hear Twistzz drop from silo. Even though what happened to Tabsen yesterday was unfortunate, I'd say that having a crowd is an integral part of t1 cs. Before ppl say that TOs get soundproof booths like in dota, pros have said that they can still hear/feel the crowd vibrations and it isn't practical from an financial perspective.
If it's allowed then its ok
It’s just part of a live match, to be expected

The crowd will always give signals whether pros bait for it or not. It’s fair game considering any pro can do it, and it’s not considered between pros to be a terrible thing to do, no “gentleman’s agreement” against it or something. Is what it is when it’s a LAN environment

It’s LAN experience. Part of winning the major, or anything, is to overcome the stress from crowds. Adapt it or leave it. Or don’t whine if one day all pro matches are being played in bubble just like covid times

If the Teams and Players *Really Really Really* wanted for Crowd sounds giving away plays to not happen, they'd have pushed event organizers for 100% Sound Isolation solutions.

This isn't a thing because Players & Teams themselves don't consider it a high-priority issue. They're fine with it (outside of the 20 seconds after it happens to them of course).
Fair game given its a live match. You got to use whatever advantage you can to your benefit if it means winning the game/tournament.
It’s part of the game and within this lan environment totally fine, even expected
It's awful but most people don't mind it so nothing you can do.

Its definitely scummy but so many players do it that they kinda have to, as well as its unavoidable to an extent unless you somehow get the crowd to be completely silent. It can also be a disadvantage if the crowds reacting to player A but player B thinks theyre the one about to get in a fight and so gives away their position, which i think happened yesterday on ancient in the mongols heroic match.
